Implement a repository which proxies a remote HTTP site and stores any files of any format in the CMA repository storage facet. Only GET requests are honored others are rejected . Configuration parameters include the remote URL being proxied, the not found and stored item expiry times. This will serve as a reference implementation for more complex formats proxy repositories.

Implement a simple bucket of files that allows for any file to be shared, so that they appear to be a repository while preserving the path. This is the simplest of the repo formats in Nexus. Equivalant of Site Repository from Nexus 2. We did this because Maven uploaded files such as HTML to describe your repo. This allows for to be shared.

We are currently unofficially supporting Java 8 we would like to officially support it. The only way to do that is run all Nexus tests using CI Java 8 on release branches. This task is about setting this up permanently. In addition any further work required to officially support Java 8 should be done.
